definitions.definition: A period of low alternating current line voltage , causing a reduction in illumination .
examples: When demand for electricity exceeds the available supply, a brownout occurs.

definitions.definition: A temporary dimming of vision , usually with a brown hue and accompanied by loss of peripheral vision or tunnel vision .
examples: On rising suddenly from her chair she experienced a brownout and had to sit down again quickly.

definitions.definition: A temporary closing of a fire station , usually due to budget restrictions.
examples: Fire departments across the country have been forced to rely on rolling brownouts because of the recession.

definitions.definition: A power outage during the day; distinguished from a blackout , which occurs at night.
A moment or period where something is weakened , diminished or less effective .
A blackout , regardless of time of day.

main_definition: ( electricity ) A period of low alternating current line voltage , causing a reduction in illumination .
secondary_definitions: A temporary dimming of vision , usually with a brown hue and accompanied by loss of peripheral vision or tunnel vision .
( firefighting ) A temporary closing of a fire station , usually due to budget restrictions.
A power outage during the day; distinguished from a blackout , which occurs at night.
( figurative , uncommon ) A moment or period where something is weakened , diminished or less effective .
( Philippines , Australia , Hong Kong ) A blackout , regardless of time of day.
